Our work Address short title generation for a news aggregation service,
where editors create short titles to introduce important articles
Contributions Show a practical use case of neural headline generation
Most news articles basically already have headlines
Propose an encoder-decoder model with multiple encoders
Deploy our model to an editing support tool
and show the results of comparing the editors behavior
Biggest news portal in Japan PV/month: 15,000,000,000+
Short title generation as editing support
Purpose: To generate short title candidates to help editors
Task: Translation from (headline, lead) to short title Lead is a short version (summary) of the article
Conditional language model consisting of two RNNs Described by three components (encoder, attention, decoder)
Attention calculates a context from the encoders states
Combine headline and lead contexts w/ gating mechanism
263K triples of (headline, lead, short title) in Yahoo! News Training (90%), validation (5%), testing (5%)
Extractively solvable instances: 20% Characters in each short title are completely covered by the headline
Edit distance of headlines and short titles: 23.74 Short titles cannot be easily created only from headlines
Lead encoder: CNN (Kim, 2014) To reduce the computational time
Hyper-parameter settings are listed in the right table
Two crowdsourcing tasks for readability and usefulness Average score of 10 workers for each of 1,000 outputs
Readability (four-point scale) How readable a short title was
Usefulness (four-point scale) How useful a short title was compared to the headline
Our model performed well for the usefulness measure

Our model worked even in this real-world application
Editors can check candidates when creating short titles
Skipping redundant candidates If edit distance<y
Highlighting unknown characters If not in the article
Editors behavior in three weeks before/after the release Rate at which an editors title matches the generated one by X%
Editors began to refer to generated outputs after the release
Short titles were successfully generated for editing support
Editors began to refer to generated titles of our system

Need a much safer model to avoid generating fake titles
